sn51.31:4.1: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
sn51.31:4.2: “What do you think, mendicants? What things has the mendicant Moggallāna developed and cultivated so as to have such power and might?”
sn51.31:5.1: “Our teachings are rooted in the Buddha. He is our guide and refuge. …”
sn51.31:5.2: “The mendicant Moggallāna has become so powerful and mighty by developing and cultivating the four bases of psychic power.
sn51.31:6.2: Moggallāna develops the basis for psychic power that has samādhi due to enthusiasm, and active endeavor.
sn51.31:6.3: He thinks: ‘My enthusiasm won’t be too lax or too tense. And it’ll be neither contracted internally nor scattered externally.’
sn51.31:6.5: as before, so after; as after, so before;
sn51.31:6.6: as below, so above; as above, so below;
sn51.31:6.7: as by day, so by night; as by night, so by day.
sn51.31:6.8: And so, with an open and unenveloped heart, he develops a mind that’s full of radiance.
sn51.31:6.9: He develops the basis for psychic power that has samādhi due to energy …
sn51.31:6.12: He thinks: ‘My inquiry won’t be too lax or too tense. And it’ll be neither contracted internally nor scattered externally.’ …
sn51.31:6.13: And so, with an open and unenveloped heart, he develops a mind that’s full of radiance.
sn51.31:6.14: The mendicant Moggallāna has become so powerful and mighty by developing and cultivating these four bases of psychic power.
sn51.31:7.1: And by developing and cultivating these four bases of psychic power, the mendicant Moggallāna wields the many kinds of psychic power:
sn51.31:7.2: multiplying himself and becoming one again …
sn51.31:7.3: controlling the body as far as the Brahmā realm.
sn51.31:7.4: And by developing and cultivating these four bases of psychic power, the mendicant Moggallāna realizes the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life. And he lives having achieved it with his own insight due to the end of defilements.”
